2019-11-17T19:07:27Z: Here's the report after a mad Brazilian Grand Prix - just one left on the calendar now, in two weeks at Abu Dhabi. See ya then! Brazilian GP: Verstappen wins from Gasly, while Ferraris collideMax Verstappen won a crazy Brazilian Grand Prix in which Toro Rosso's Pierre Gasly claimed his first Formula 1 podium in second and the two Ferraris collided with each other
2019-11-17T19:00:38Z: Toro Rosso also leapfrogs Racing Point in the teams' standings, and now looks set to have sixth place locked in.
2019-11-17T18:59:35Z: The net result of that is that Gasly actually returns to sixth place in the championship, leapfrogging Sainz and Albon. Hands up if you saw that coming...nobody?
2019-11-17T18:52:16Z: The tension in the Ferrari debrief will be one you can cut with a breadknife. We'd love to be a fly on the wall there...
2019-11-17T18:50:33Z: Hulkenberg, meanwhile, gets a five-second penalty for overtaking Magnussen too early at the restart.
2019-11-17T18:49:57Z: The Albon/Hamilton incident is under investigation now.
2019-11-17T18:49:08Z: Should that have been Albon's P2? Probably. But Gasly was in the place to capitalise - and he did so expertly.
2019-11-17T18:48:25Z: Wow. Who on earth expected that one? That was IndyCar stuff between Gasly and Hamilton at the end of the race, but it's the Frenchman who grabs second place against all the odds.
2019-11-17T18:47:15Z: Final order: 1 Verstappen, 2 Gasly, 3 Hamilton, 4 Sainz, 5 Raikkonen, 6 Giovinazzi, 7 Ricciardo, 8 Norris, 9 Perez, 10 Kvyat, 11 Magnussen, 12 Hulkenberg, 13 Russell, 14 Grosjean, 15 Albon, 16 Kubica.
2019-11-17T18:47:01Z: Hamilton's clash with Albon is under investigation.
2019-11-17T18:46:49Z: Verstappen wins the Brazilian Grand Prix, and Gasly holds off Hamilton by just 0.062s to take second!
2019-11-17T18:46:31Z: Hamilton is carrying wing damage from that clash with Albon, who was sent right down to 15th.
2019-11-17T18:46:01Z: Verstappen goes onto the last lap with a 5s lead over Gasly, who Hamilton is now attacking.
2019-11-17T18:45:45Z: Gasly gets through to second as Hamilton recovers, Albon is spun to the tail of the field!
2019-11-17T18:45:20Z: Hamilton is all over the back of Albon for second place.
2019-11-17T18:44:55Z: Verstappen leaves it as late as he can to hit the throttle, nearly reaching the starting grid before going for it. Hamilton immediately takes third from Gasly, and has a look at Albon as the Red Bull locks up.
2019-11-17T18:43:41Z: Right, the race looks like it'll go green for a two-lap dash with a Red Bull sort of 1-2-3 and Hamilton on fresh tyres right behind.
2019-11-17T18:42:37Z: Three laps to go, and the safety car is still out while debris is cleared. Will this race actually go green?
2019-11-17T18:41:28Z: Stroll has pulled up with a broken suspension! It just gave out on him as he cruised around under SC.
2019-11-17T18:41:04Z: Back to the Ferrari incident, Leclerc had passed Vettel into the Senna S and was ahead but Vettel got a run on the next straight and moved ahead. Then Vettel moved slightly left and they touched, instantly breaking Leclerc's front suspension. Vettel's rear tyre then burst and he also parked up.
2019-11-17T18:40:22Z: Order under SC: 1 Verstappen, 2 Albon, 3 Gasly, 4 Hamilton, 5 Sainz, 6 Raikkonen, 7 Giovinazzi, 8 Ricciardo, 9 Norris, 10 Perez, 11 Hulkenberg, 12 Magnussen, 13 Kvyat, 14 Russell, 15 Grosjean, 16 Kubica.
2019-11-17T18:39:50Z: So it's now Verstappen leading Albon and Gasly, with Hamilton on very new tyres in fourth but surely there won't be many laps of racing left when this safety car comes in.
2019-11-17T18:39:18Z: Hamilton has dived into the pits, and he falls to fourth behind Gasly with that stop.
2019-11-17T18:38:09Z: Mattia Binotto looks crestfallen on the pitwall.
2019-11-17T18:37:53Z: The safety car is deployed, with both Ferraris slowing with damaged cars.
2019-11-17T18:37:33Z: Leclerc dives ahead of Vettel and then they collide!
2019-11-17T18:37:02Z: Leclerc, who has fresher tyres, is all over the back of Vettel for fourth.
2019-11-17T18:36:45Z: Verstappen is now nearly 4s clear of Hamilton in the race lead with six laps left.
2019-11-17T18:36:30Z: Sainz has dropped to five seconds behind Gasly in eighth, but he is still keeping the Alfas at bay on his super-worn mediums. So, maybe good strategy after all - and really good driving.
2019-11-17T18:35:50Z: Having to focus on keeping the Ferraris at bay is stopping Albon being able to attack Hamilton for second, though.
2019-11-17T18:35:08Z: Vettel edges ahead of Albon down the outside towards the Senna S but Albon brakes late and holds on to third.
2019-11-17T18:34:43Z: Vettel is attacking Albon hard for third.
2019-11-17T18:34:22Z: Verstappen is now 3.3s clear in the lead.
2019-11-17T18:34:07Z: A replay shows Vettel took Albon very wide into the second part of the Senna S as the Red Bull went around his outside, but Albon stuck with it, used a bit of grass and made the move stick.
2019-11-17T18:32:24Z: Sainz is hanging on to seventh now, but it's seemingly a matter of time, while Grosjean is already out of the points, overtaken by Giovinazzi and Ricciardo. Not sure we understand this 'stay out on very worn tyres' strategy.
2019-11-17T18:32:20Z: The three cars behind second-placed Hamilton are all on newer tyres, a lot newer in fifth-placed Leclerc's case.
2019-11-17T18:31:37Z: Verstappen is absolutely clearing off - he's already 2.1s clear of Hamilton. Now can Albon attack Hamilton with his newer tyres?
2019-11-17T18:31:17Z: Lead order now: 1 Verstappen; 2 Hamilton; 3 Albon; 4 Vettel; 5 Leclerc. 10 laps to go
2019-11-17T18:31:00Z: Albon storms around the outside of Vettel to take third, with Leclerc getting past Vettel temporarily as the Ferraris sort themselves out mid-corner following Albon's pass.
2019-11-17T18:30:36Z: Sainz picks off Grosjean on the restart for seventh, and Raikkonen follows suit.
2019-11-17T18:30:10Z: And it doesn't take long - Verstappen attacks Hamilton straight away and goes around the outside into the Senna S to retake the lead at the restart!
2019-11-17T18:27:29Z: Bottas's car has long since been cleared out of the way, but the safety car period is being prolonged to let the lapped cars unlap themselves.
2019-11-17T18:23:30Z: Order under SC: 1 Hamilton, 2 Verstappen, 3 Vettel, 4 Albon, 5 Leclerc, 6 Gasly, 7 Grosjean, 8 Sainz, 9 Raikkonen, 10 Giovinazzi, 11 Perez, 12 Ricciardo, 13 Kvyat, 14 Norris, 15 Stroll, 16 Magnussen, 17 Hulkenberg, 18 Russell, 19 Kubica.
2019-11-17T18:22:42Z: Among the midfield runners, it's Norris, Stroll, Magnussen and Hulkenberg pitting. Grosjean and Sainz have bravely stayed out on severely worn mediums, for some reason.
2019-11-17T18:21:03Z: Verstappen goes back to soft tyres and he's still second to Hamilton because of the field slowing for the safety car.
2019-11-17T18:20:45Z: Leclerc also makes a pitstop during this yellow.
2019-11-17T18:20:07Z: And Red Bull reacts to that safety car by bringing Verstappen in for another pitstop from the race lead.
2019-11-17T18:19:27Z: And now the safety car is being deployed!
2019-11-17T18:18:10Z: Albon is very rapidly catching Leclerc for fourth place.
2019-11-17T18:17:54Z: Verstappen and Hamilton do identical lap times on that one. They're now just under a second apart in the lead battle.
2019-11-17T18:17:48Z: Sainz gets ahead of Norris for ninth place, and Raikkonen follows suit a lap later, breaking back into the top 10 (make that top nine as Bottas parks up).
2019-11-17T18:17:26Z: Bottas is slowing, his race is over. He parks the car and retires from fifth place.
2019-11-17T18:16:59Z: There's a lot of smoke out of the back of Bottas's Mercedes!
2019-11-17T18:16:18Z: Albon has also taken softs and is 8s behind the Leclerc/Bottas battle for fourth.
2019-11-17T18:15:56Z: Verstappen isn't managing to shake Hamilton off this time, the Mercedes is staying just over a second behind him.
2019-11-17T18:15:35Z: Vettel put softs back on during that pitstop. He should rapidly pass Albon - in fact he won't need to as Albon immediately makes his own second pitstop and falls back to sixth.
2019-11-17T18:15:32Z: Gasly eases past Grosjean for seventh, while Raikkonen's charge is being complicated by Sainz running within DRS range of Norris.
2019-11-17T18:14:28Z: Bottas is all over the back of Leclerc, still.
2019-11-17T18:14:14Z: So Verstappen is back into the lead, 1.7s ahead of Hamilton with 21 laps left.
2019-11-17T18:13:59Z: Vettel comes back out fourth behind Albon.
2019-11-17T18:13:42Z: Verstappen is now right on Vettel's tail... and Vettel pits.
2019-11-17T18:13:21Z: Leclerc locks up slightly in the infield, will this give Bottas a run onto the straight? Nope, not by enough...
2019-11-17T18:13:11Z: Gasly and Raikkonen have pitted too, and Gasly has only lost one place by doing so, rejoining ahead of the two McLarens! He should make quick work of Grosjean to reclaim seventh, and looks well on course to a 'Class B win'.
2019-11-17T18:12:54Z: Verstappen is very soon going to be within DRS range of leader Vettel.
2019-11-17T18:12:05Z: Giovinazzi and Kvyat have likewise made their second stops. The Italian rejoins in 13th but should have a reasonably straightforward time fighting back into the points.
2019-11-17T18:11:46Z: Verstappen has taken another 2.1s out of Vettel's lead on that lap. The gap is now 3.2s. This time Hamilton was 0.4s slower than Verstappen.
2019-11-17T18:11:11Z: Bottas still isn't managing to overtake Leclerc for fifth even with fresher, softer tyres and DRS.
2019-11-17T18:10:49Z: Perez and Hulkenberg commit to two-stoppers, both switching to softs. They rejoin in 15th and 18th respectively.
2019-11-17T18:10:45Z: Lead gaps on lap 46: 1 Vettel; 2 Verstappen +4.1s; 3 Hamilton +5.4s
2019-11-17T18:10:23Z: Verstappen takes 1.5s off leader Vettel on his first flying lap. Hamilton was a couple of tenths faster than Verstappen there.
2019-11-17T18:10:00Z: Bottas can't quite pass Leclerc yet, despite a bit of a look into the first corner.
2019-11-17T18:09:12Z: Bottas has now caught Leclerc for fifth place on his new tyres.
2019-11-17T18:08:41Z: Those pitstops have put Vettel into the lead. He doesn't have to stop again for rules reasons - he's already used softs and mediums - but he may want to stop for tyre wear reasons. He's 7s ahead of Verstappen.
2019-11-17T18:08:08Z: Again Red Bull responds and brings Verstappen straight in. This time he stays clearly ahead of Hamilton, who's had a bit of traffic on his out-lap. Verstappen's also taken new mediums.
2019-11-17T18:07:06Z: Bottas and his fresh mediums do a new fastest race lap of 1m10.698s, which is 2.5s than Leclerc and his older tyres ahead.
2019-11-17T18:06:37Z: Hamilton duly pits and rejoins third behind Vettel.
2019-11-17T18:05:27Z: Here's a look at Kubica and Verstappen's near miss in the pits earlier
2019-11-17T18:04:47Z: Bottas comes back out in sixth, 5.3s behind Leclerc. He's taken mediums.
2019-11-17T18:04:37Z: Ricciardo pits from 11th after a 32-lap stint on softs. His pace was pretty respectable in the end there, and you maybe wouldn't put it past him yet salvaging something from this race.
2019-11-17T18:04:06Z: Bottas is indeed two-stopping - he comes in from fourth place.
2019-11-17T18:03:38Z: Both Mercedes drivers and Verstappen have recently let their teams know that it's getting more windy.
2019-11-17T18:03:23Z: Lead gaps: 1 Verstappen; 2 Hamilton +3.3s; 3 Vettel +13.3s; 4 Bottas +23.3s; 5 Albon +27.2s; 6 Leclerc +40.0s
2019-11-17T18:02:53Z: Mercedes radio traffic suggests Bottas might be two-stopping, which is odd given that he ran quite long on his first stint and then took hards.
2019-11-17T18:02:36Z: Five seconds now between Gasly and Raikkonen for 'Class B' honours, with Giovinazzi a further five down on his fellow Alfa driver.
2019-11-17T17:59:44Z: Closest battle on track is between Norris and Kvyat right now, with the Toro Rosso man on softs looking to find a way past the hard-shod McLaren.
2019-11-17T17:59:38Z: In the rest of the top six, Albon is occasionally getting a bit closer to fourth-placed Bottas but it's not super-thrilling. Leclerc's strategy isn't working out hugely well for him - he's unable to reduce the 13s gap to Albon ahead in fifth.
2019-11-17T17:59:02Z: Hamilton does his best lap of the race so far and pulls a little bit of time back to Verstappen, getting the gap under 3s for the first time in a while.
2019-11-17T17:58:14Z: Grosjean is the one who lost out the most in the midfield in that opening pit cycle, dropping behind Giovinazzi and Perez. He is, however, among the few cars on hards and might fancy making it to the end without stopping again.
2019-11-17T17:54:11Z: Verstappen has got his lead over Hamilton up to 3s for the first time now. But the fastest of the lead trio is Vettel by a tenth or so. Either he's staying out to the end, loves these mediums and is in very good shape, or he's pushing the mediums hard because he's also two-stopping.
2019-11-17T17:53:42Z: Order: 1 Verstappen, 2 Hamilton, 3 Vettel, 4 Bottas, 5 Albon, 6 Leclerc, 7 Gasly, 8 Raikkonen, 9 Giovinazzi, 10 Perez, 11 Ricciardo, 12 Grosjean, 13 Norris, 14 Kvyat, 15 Sainz, 16 Stroll, 17 Hulkenberg, 18 Magnussen, 19 Russell, 20 Kubica.
2019-11-17T17:52:30Z: It's a five-second time penalty for Kubica and Williams. That'll teach them.
2019-11-17T17:52:09Z: Vettel is matching the two leaders' pace now even though he's on a harder compound of tyre. Both Verstappen and Hamilton have to stop again, Vettel potentially needn't.
2019-11-17T17:51:34Z: Gaps and tyres: 1 Verstappen (softs, must stop again); 2 Hamilton +2.5s (softs, must stop again); 3 Vettel +12.8s (meds); 4 Bottas +21.0s (hards); 5 Albon +26.3s (meds); 6 Leclerc +39.5s (hards)
2019-11-17T17:50:43Z: Leclerc has taken hard tyres in that stop.
2019-11-17T17:50:42Z: Sainz becomes the last driver in the field to make his first stop, which drops him to 15th place behind Kvyat. Team-mate Norris is running 13th behind Grosjean, McLaren has certainly had better races than this.
2019-11-17T17:49:56Z: Plan C for Leclerc turns out to be to make his pitstop, which he does. He rejoins in sixth and will surely go to the end from here.
2019-11-17T17:48:42Z: Vettel passes his yet to stop team-mate Leclerc for third and sets a new fastest lap of 1m12.259s.
2019-11-17T17:47:39Z: To recap on what happened around the pitstops in the lead battle - Hamilton pitted first and a supreme out-lap coupled with Kubica baulking Verstappen in the pits meant the Mercedes took the lead. But Verstappen rapidly pounced and repasses Hamilton on track.
2019-11-17T17:47:15Z: Gasly has cycled back through into ninth place - he's overtaken Stroll and Hulkenberg, who are still staying out there, on track. It becomes eighth place as Norris pits ahead.
2019-11-17T17:47:06Z: Lead order on lap 27: 1 Verstappen; 2 Hamilton +1.9s; 3 Leclerc +11.5s (yet to pit); 4 Vettel +14.4s; 5 Bottas +22.3s; 6 Albon +27.0s
2019-11-17T17:46:30Z: Bottas took hards rather than mediums in his stop. He rejoins between Vettel and Albon.
2019-11-17T17:46:23Z: Russell has overtaken Kubica with DRS on the main straight for 19th place - they're in the process of being lapped by Vettel.
2019-11-17T17:45:30Z: Bottas dives into the pits, so it's Verstappen leading from Hamilton now by 2.2s.
2019-11-17T17:45:15Z: The Verstappen/Kubica incident is now under investigation.
2019-11-17T17:45:12Z: Verstappen has now caught the still-to-stop Bottas and probably won't need long to pass him for the lead.
2019-11-17T17:44:52Z: Vettel now pits from the lead and takes on medium tyres. He rejoins fifth between Leclerc and Albon.
2019-11-17T17:44:35Z: Stewards have 'noted' the Verstappen/Kubica incident in the pitlane. It was a somewhat questionably-timed release from the pits by Williams, and then Kubica came fairly close to putting Verstappen into the outside wall on pitlane exit.
2019-11-17T17:44:27Z: Albon now makes a pitstop. He goes onto mediums so can one-stop and rejoins in seventh behind Grosjean.
2019-11-17T17:43:01Z: Hamilton has gone around the outside of Albon into the Senna S to take fourth from the Red Bull.
2019-11-17T17:42:20Z: Gasly has pitted from the head of the midfield pack, and returns to the track in 13th - behind team-mate Kvyat and ahead of the likes of Raikkonen and Giovinazzi.
2019-11-17T17:42:08Z: Verstappen is storming, a 1m12.448s to take fastest lap.
2019-11-17T17:41:56Z: Hamilton tries to attack again on the back straight but Verstappen's got this sorted. And he's swiftly past team-mate Albon into third too.
2019-11-17T17:41:26Z: Verstappen then quickly attacks Hamilton and dives inside Hamilton to take the lead into the Senna S!
2019-11-17T17:41:09Z: Hamilton and Verstappen are now behind the yet-to-pit Leclerc. They both nip past in quick succession, though.
2019-11-17T17:40:38Z: Verstappen has a near-miss with Kubica's Williams in the pitlane, and Hamilton is ahead as the Red Bull exits the pitlane!
2019-11-17T17:39:51Z: Alfa Romeo has pitted Giovinazzi, and the Italian comes out right ahead of Perez in 16th. Raikkonen follows suit a lap later.
2019-11-17T17:39:27Z: Verstappen's stop puts Vettel into a temporary lead by 6s over Bottas.
2019-11-17T17:39:09Z: Red Bull reacts quickly and Verstappen pits on the next lap.
2019-11-17T17:38:56Z: Hamilton sticks with softs, so he's definitely two-stopping, and he rejoins in sixth place just behind Gasly.
2019-11-17T17:35:49Z: And we have our first scheduled pitstop, as Perez switches from softs to mediums and emerges from the pits right ahead of Ricciardo.
2019-11-17T17:34:50Z: Out front in the midfield race, Gasly is leading Raikkonen by three seconds, but he is already eight seconds back from Leclerc.
2019-11-17T17:34:04Z: Ricciardo has overtaken Russell for 19th, and makes quick work of Kubica shortly thereafter..
2019-11-17T17:33:31Z: After those few laps where Hamilton was getting a bit closer, Verstappen is pulling clear once more. The lead is heading back up to 2.5s.
2019-11-17T17:33:12Z: Vettel, Bottas and Albon are all losing half a second per lap to the top two now, with Leclerc closing to within 2.4s of Albon for fifth.
2019-11-17T17:32:32Z: Leclerc pushing on to chase the leaders
2019-11-17T17:31:47Z: Ricciardo receives a five-second time penalty for the collision with Magnussen. Cherry on top, that.
2019-11-17T17:31:31Z: Hamilton is inching a tiny bit closer to Verstappen as this stint goes on - lapping up to 0.2s quicker at present.
2019-11-17T17:30:45Z: The closest battle on track at this moment is between the Williams team-mates, with Russel running six tenths behind Kubica after dropping behind the Pole at the start.
2019-11-17T17:29:42Z: Lead gaps on lap 13: 1 Verstappen; 2 Hamilton +2.0s; 3 Vettel +5.3s; 4 Bottas +10.3s; 5 Albon +13.7s; 6 Leclerc +16.6s
2019-11-17T17:28:19Z: Red Bull checks in with Verstappen about his tyre condition, and he reports a small amount of vibration but otherwise all good.
2019-11-17T17:27:22Z: The gap has stabilised between the leaders - Hamilton still 2.4s in arrears of Verstappen as the race goes onto lap 12 of 71.
2019-11-17T17:26:36Z: Magnussen/Ricciardo is under investigation by the stewards.
2019-11-17T17:25:52Z: Having cleared Gasly, Leclerc is 4s behind Albon up ahead in fifth. How much longer than the leaders will Leclerc run on his medium tyres?
2019-11-17T17:25:51Z: Order: 1 Verstappen, 2 Hamilton, 3 Vettel, 4 Bottas, 5 Albon, 6 Leclerc, 7 Gasly, 8 Raikkonen, 9 Grosjean, 10 Giovinazzi, 11 Norris, 12 Stroll, 13 Sainz, 14 Perez, 15 Hulkenberg, 16 Kvyat, 17 Magnussen, 18 Kubica, 19 Russell, 20 Ricciardo.
2019-11-17T17:24:51Z: Leclerc overtakes Gasly for sixth place. He has now officially cleared the midfield, and is 15 seconds off race leader Verstappen.
2019-11-17T17:24:02Z: The pair came to blow as Ricciardo tried to pass the struggling Haas down the inside of Turn 4. Ricciardo continues in 13th but has to pit at the end of the lap, while Magnussen rejoins between the two Williams cars.
2019-11-17T17:23:00Z: Ricciardo taps Magnussen into a spin!
2019-11-17T17:22:31Z: Giovinazzi has found his way into the top 10 alongside his Alfa Romeo team-mate. This came at the expense of Magnussen, who is already down to 13th, which is a very familiar story down at Haas.
2019-11-17T17:21:29Z: Leclerc has eased past Grosjean, but has a somewhat tougher time passing Raikkonen. He finally gets a straightforward DRS move done on the main straight.
2019-11-17T17:20:57Z: Bottas has now managed to give himself a bit of breathing space over the feisty Albon for fourth.
2019-11-17T17:19:55Z: Verstappen making a break for it on lap one
2019-11-17T17:19:29Z: Onto lap five, lead gaps: 1 Verstappen; 2 Hamilton +2.5s; 3 Vettel +4.1s; 4 Bottas +6.0s; 5 Albon +7.0s
2019-11-17T17:18:48Z: Replays show a brave overtake from Sainz on Perez down the inside of Turn 1. The Spaniard, who started last due to engine malaise on Saturday, is up to 15th and has Ricciardo in his sights.
2019-11-17T17:18:03Z: Verstappen is storming away at the moment, his lead already 2.3s. Closest among the top five now are Bottas and Albon, with the second Red Bull within DRS range of the Mercedes ahead.
2019-11-17T17:17:40Z: Make that ninth place for Leclerc as he eases past Magnussen for ninth - just as Raikkonen overtakes Grosjean for seventh ahead of them.
2019-11-17T17:17:33Z: A replay of the start shows Hamilton took full advantage of Vettel attacking Verstappen into the first corner as he went around the outside of the Ferrari into the Senna S.
2019-11-17T17:16:37Z: Gasly has kept sixth place as the best of the midfield cars, and even briefly seemed to challenge Albon for fifth. Leclerc now up to 10th at Giovinazzi's expense.
2019-11-17T17:15:55Z: Leclerc is up to 13th after the start, and manages to get ahead of Ricciardo before the end of the opening lap. He tries to get past Norris, but is blocked at Juncao - only to move past with relative ease on the start-finish straight.
2019-11-17T17:15:54Z: Verstappen is already 1.7s clear of Hamilton in the race lead. Bottas is pressuring Vettel for third.
2019-11-17T17:14:58Z: Verstappen gets a slight break as Vettel attacks Hamilton for second. Bottas and Albon slot in behind them.
2019-11-17T17:14:36Z: Vettel looks to the inside of Verstappen but Hamilton goes around the outside of the Ferrari to take second.
2019-11-17T17:13:54Z: Verstappen lines up on his pole position.
2019-11-17T17:12:39Z: Everyone's on softs, except Ricciardo, Hulkenberg, Leclerc, Kvyat, Russell and Kubica.
2019-11-17T17:10:37Z: The formation lap is now underway. It's a very short one here.
2019-11-17T17:08:43Z: Just a couple of minutes before we get up and running! Hard to believe this is already the penultimate race of the year...
2019-11-17T17:07:52Z: It's a sunny Sunday in Sao Paulo, and with a few cars out of position, it could be a rather interesting race indeed. Can Leclerc tear through the field? Can Sainz make his way into the points? Can Artam used to race in GP2 back in 2005...
2019-11-17T17:00:14Z: Good afternoon! Just 10 minutes until the Brazilian Grand Prix at Interlagos will begin...so don't go anywhere!
